c74object.name: bach.path2llll
c74object.digest: Obtain full directory tree in llll form
c74object.description: Converts a directory path into an llll containing the full information about its files and subfolders. Subfolders are represented by sublists, whose first elements are the subfolder names.

outlet.digest: The directory tree with full element paths

objarg.name: pathname
objarg.description: A symbol as argument specifies the initial path name.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the directory tree of the most recently received input path.

method.name: symbol
method.description: A symbol is considered to be the path to the folder which has to be inspected. All the files and subfolder contained in the entered folder are organized in llll form and output, under the convention that each subfolder are represented by a sublist whose first element is the subfolder name. Left outlet outputs such tree in llll form. Right outlet outputs the same tree where each element retains its full path. As always, right outlets fires before the left one.

attribute.name: folderpos
attribute.description: Sets the file ordering type: Mixed (0), Folders First (1), Files First (2).

attribute.name: fullinitpath
attribute.description: The word types, followed by one or more four-letter filetype codes, sets the file types that the object will look for in the specified folder (see the folder object for more information).

attribute.name: nosort
attribute.description: Toggle the ability to avoid file-specific sorting of the symbols, where files are compared ignoring the case, and where some elements such as underscores, spaces or tilde will come before any letter in the file ordering. Default is 0. Toggle this attribute to drastically reduce computation time, if you have folders containing a lot of data.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: The output of bach.path2llll can be connected with a bach.tree object, with the firsteleminllllisllllname attribute set to 1.
